page.title: 13HOLSWORTHY LEISURE CENTRE
page.content: Holsworthy leisure centre was built in 1981 as a joint sports facility for the local community and the Community College. During the day its used by pupils of the College and in the evenings by the public.The facilities it offers include:archery,badminton,basketball, bowls,climbing,cricket,gymnastics, hockey,judo,karate,indoorfootball, rollerskating and volley ball. The centre is approx. 60m*30m which includes an indoor sports hall, changing rooms,offices,stores, amusements and canteen. The sport hall charges are very cheap ranging from 10p for admission to Â£5 for hiring fees. Approximately 800 people use the leisure centre weekly.The Torridge District Council administers the centre.
